item.desc:
General Moves that you can make:
-"describe around" will describe the things that you can touch currently on your stop.
-"describe _____" will tell you more about that item that is near you. But watch out!
-> By asking to describe an item you could enter a Twitter or Trivia challenge!
-"current" will relay your inventory of stuff!
Game Play: -Earn @s and #s in the shortest amount of time possible.
-Typing load- allows you to load previous games.
-Typing save- allows you to save previous games.
-If you look at someone, you might have to start a twitter battle with them! Here, if you don't choose your call and word wisely they can steal your hash or @s.
Generally the goal of the game is to
a.) survive the game and
b.) have the most @s and #s acquired by the end of the game

This is your gun, that you might need...
You know... for reasons.
item.usage: Waving your gun around can generally scare off a bitch.
Bullets flyin', babies cryin. You sighin. Just another day in the hood G!
Sometimes, you just gotta dodge people.
The best way to get around someone.

stop.desc:
Having a rough, young life in the heart of the Bronx.
All you've ever wanted for yourself is to make it as the hottest.
MOST BADASS MC OF ALL TIME.
Toughest market in the United States right here.
In order to work your way up the ranks, you have to make it to
Brooklyn on the 4,5,6 train unscathed and with more hash then you started with.

Along the way, you'll meet some characters who will challenge your wit
and try to steal your reputation (also called holler-ats or @s)
and stash (also called rhymes, hashtags and #s), but fear not!
You're a mean muggin' thug, and you know the Twittersphere.

Whenever a person, place or thing decides to give you a glare,
You must challenge the boss with your own gang call and holler-count.
Your holler-count is the amount of defeats you have already

Along the subway, you can decide to trade your life of crime for a life as an MC.
That is the reason the Dom Bros decided to recruit you in the first place.
You've got fly tunes and you know how to spin.

If you run into another MC on the tracks,
You can increase your holler-ats by pressing enter
And guessing the currently playing MC before your time expires.

As far as the basics:
To learn more about game play type "how" and enter
For more info on current stop -- type enter.
To learn more about your surroundings -- type "describe around".
To challenge or check something out -- type "glare" followed by its name!
If you've saved your game previously, you can "load" the previous game.
Otherwise type "start"!
Start the game (start) or load (load) a previous game?

place.desc: Start the game!!!

stop.desc:
Are you really that curious to figure more about the start of this game?
Time's a wasting!
There aren't many options here, so choose wisely!

They pressed enter again... must be pretty desperate at this point....
How about you try typing "how" to learn more about the game?

place.desc: You need a ticket to get on the subway!!
You can buy a ticket here...
Run for your life!

item.desc: There's an old lady reaching for the ticket too!

stop.desc: It's a long-line but you can buy a ticket here...

place.desc: If you buy a ticket at the kiosk, you've got yourself on the train.
If you just can't handle the kiosk....

item.desc: The Kiosk Attendant wants you to hurry up!
There's a crotchedy old lady behind you that's waiting for her ticket.

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
The Express Six Train is here!
Death by driveby.

item.desc: There's a smelly bum.
Kennedy's Fried Chicken.
Chirp, chirp, chirp!! You think this is food poisoning? Take a bite!

stop.desc:
You are on the express between Parkchester and Huntspoint.
There are a lot of people on the train,
But let's be real there are only a few people that are reall too important
The bloods and the crips

place.desc: This is the next stop on the train!

item.desc: They're so fresh... from the crips
Gang warfare

stop.desc:
___ _ ___ _ ___ __ ___ __ \ | | / | | | | | \ | | (__ __) ) ____) | \_/ | | | | | | |\ \ | | | | ( (___ | _ | | | | | | | \ \| | | | \___ \ | / \ | | \_/ | | | \ | | | ____) ) / |___| \__\ /__| |___\ |____| |____( (__
The neighborhood is part of Bronx Community Board 2.
Its boundaries are the Bruckner Expressway to the west and north,
the Bronx River to the east (I bet they have some fresh fish there),
and the East River to the south.

Hunts Point Avenue is the primary street through Hunts Point.
The neighborhood is considered to be a "Red Light District"
in many cases for its crime and prostitution

place.desc: Express is here.

item.desc:
Huntspoint is known for their pimps and hos.
Fo sho....
There is a pimp with a big old hat.

stop.desc:
You're on the second leg of the express!
It's a party out there,
but you gotta make it to the BK!

item.desc: Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc: You can get back on the Express... we're still in the Bronx

Third Avenue is a north-south thoroughfare on the East Side of the New York City borough of Manhattan,
Running from Cooper Square north for over 120 blocks.
The street leaves Manhattan and continues into The Bronx across the Harlem River
over the Third Avenue Bridge north of East 129th Street to East Fordham Road at Fordham Center.
It is one of the four streets that form The Hub,
a site of both maximum traffic and architectural density, in the South Bronx

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
You can always hang on the tracks.
The Express Six Train is here!

item.desc: There's a man the looks a lot like a pimp here.

You keep cursing in the subway!?
Shame on you!
Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc:
Harlem is a large neighborhood within the northern section of the New York City borough of Manhattan.
Since the 1920s, Harlem has been known as a major African-American residential,
cultural and business center.

Originally a Dutch village, formally organized in 1658,
it is named after the city of Haarlem in the Netherlands.
Harlem's history has been defined by a series of economic boom-and-bust cycles,
with significant population shifts accompanying each cycle

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
The Express Six Train is here!

item.desc: There is a business-man from Westchester. He has a long overcoat
You see a dirty, dirty pigeon with ruffled feathers and a bad attitude.

Pigeon- Intro: A pigeon is a girl who be walkin' by My rimmed up blue red loose Spark wit five Her feet hurt so you know she wanna ride But she frontin' like she can't say hi, what?
Uh oh, y'all chicks ain't gettin' nada Uh oh, ya' pussy ain't worth the Ramada Uh oh, anyway ya' friend looks hotta Uh oh, game is somethin' we got a lotta
Uh oh, 'cuz I don't want no pigeons Dem be dem girls who gets no dubz from me Playin' the bar dumb broke with her best friend's coat Tryin' to holla at me
I don't want no pigeons Dem be dem girls who gets no dubz from me Playin' the bar dumb broke with her best friend's coat Tryin' to holla at me
You're too slow to know this rapper. So it's time for a Twitter Battle!

stop.desc:
You're on the way to the upper east side from Harlem.
How excited are you?!?!

place.desc: Upper East Side!

item.desc: A little old lady is clutching her purse!
Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc:
The Upper East Side is a neighborhood in the borough of Manhattan in New York City,
between Central Park and the East River.
The Upper East Side lies within an area bounded by 59th Street to 96th Street,
and the East River to Fifth Avenue-Central Park.
The ZIP codes included in this neighborhood are 10021, 10022, 10028, 10075, 10128, 10029 and 10065.

place.desc: The Express is here!!

item.desc:
"Yo honey, I can be the girl of your dreams!
Make you famous in all those scenes.
If you know what I mean!"

stop.desc: You're back on the express! Only a few more stops to go!
You're on the way from 86th to Grand Central!

item.desc: There is a businessman next to you holding a watch.
Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc:
Although the terminal has been properly called “Grand Central Terminal” since 1913,
many people continue to refer to it as “Grand Central Station,”
the name of the previous rail station on the same site,
and of the U.S. Post Office station next door, which is not part of the terminal.
It is also sometimes used to refer to the
Grand Central – 42nd Street subway station, which serves the terminal.

place.desc: Express Train is Here.

item.desc: There is a gaggle of bums that are panhandling.

stop.desc: You're on the way to Union Square from Grand Central!

item.desc: There's a man trying to sell cabbage on this train.
Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc: YOU WIN! Hop up in your hipster palace!

place.desc: Be aware of Needles and Yuppies! Outside of St. Marks they're known to be found. Hoppin' and hollerin'. Up and down and up and down. Speedballs makes the OD baby crown, here in St. Marks. We think we're profound.

Be aware of Needles and Yuppies! Outside of St. Marks they're known to be found. Hoppin' and hollerin'. Up and down and up and down. Speedballs makes the OD baby crown, here in St. Marks. We think we're profound.

item.desc: "Like holy shit, what bands do you even know? This iPod is horrendous!"

place.desc: The Bleeker Street Stop is next

item.desc: Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

stop.desc:
Bleecker Street is a west-east street in New York City borough of Manhattan.
It is most famous today as a Greenwich Village nightclub district.
The street connects a neighborhood today popular for music venues and comedy,
but which was once a major center for American bohemia.

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
The Local six train is here!
The Express Six Train is here!
If you get off, you gotta fight to get back on!

item.desc: Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
The Express Six Train is here!
If you get off, you gotta fight to get back on!

stop.desc: Welcome to Wall Street!

place.desc: You lost your soul! How did it come to this?!

You can get back on the subway!
Ain't no shame in going back to your original idea!

item.desc: A sweet-ass leather wallet lies here.
Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

place.desc: It's dangerous down on the tracks. Dead bodies. Rats.
The Express Six Train is here!
If you get off, you gotta fight to get back on!
A man claiming to be Doc Marten has "risen from the grave" here to kick the shit out of hipsters wearing his boots.

item.desc: Even when you lose, it feels good to win!

If you get off, you gotta fight to get back on!

stop.desc: Welcome to the land of the free! You have joined a gang of rebel warriors!

There is nothing going on out here.
Type restart to restart the game.
Or type go death to exit!

item.desc: You die.

stop.desc: You die of paranoia.

game.scenario:
They beat you with their rhymes and with the crowd.
Sometimes you gotta fall to make it to the top.
Ain't nothing better than a little bit of humility.
Learn the way of the flow or you'll be lost in a state of incredulity
Thuggin so hard you gotta pass the mic.
Nothing wrong with workin your way up from a tyke.

The crowd loved your raps, but they liked theirs too!
And they definitely hollered more than you could!
Run brother, run!!
You're getting a little hoarse!

You smoked them with your flow!
But they had more hollerin!
Probably because this is their turf.
It happens to the best of us!
Time to find some new turf!

They smoked you out! And grabbed some of your rhymes!
You drawed on holler-ats!
So your crew can't help you out!
You better move on, because this sucker is all rhymed up.

It's a draw!
Somethings are better left unsaid, player.
You best dry your eyes.

You smoked them with your flow.
And so you grabbed some of their rhymes for your stash
We're rich, bitch!
You out hollered them. You mad tweeter, you! But they did smoke you out and nab some of your stash!
You sly mother. You beat that turkey! And gained some followers from his crew! Holler at it baby!!

You hollered so hard that you added some holler to your crew! Feel that beat get loose in you! Trap the mean and throw the noose. Thuggin' ain't nothin but a fist thrown loose. Pimpin' ain't nothin but a nut in refuse.
You popped them so hard you grabbed some rhymes too! Holler! Holler!
